content.description: This route ascends a mostly vertical wall with sections that are just over and just under vertical.  The technical crux comes between the first and second bolts, but don't let your guard down because the route is fairly sustained through most of it.  Fun technical route up sharp but great limestone.
content.protection: 11 bolts to 2 bolt anchor with biners
content.location: This route is the second bolt line right of the arch. The route immediately left climbs the arete of the arch.  There are a group of 5.9s on the slabby wall around the corner and up the hill also.

content.description: Was recommended to do this route by some locals at the campground suggesting it was 11a.  Felt about 10+/11-.  Start with a right facing dihedral slab to gain the obvious crack system. Jam your way up perfect hands for a few moves before heading left on to the face.  Great edges til you hit the roof to do some laybacking out left. Bomber holds to to fully rock over.  Easy moves to the chains.
content.location: Left of watery tart on the arete of the right leaning arch.  This is the left most bolt line starting from the arch.

content.description: Techy corner climb. Stem your way up via any means necessary. Tough moves throughout the third to fourth bolt. Climbing lets up the higher you get.    Great fun, prep the calves as they will get pumped!
content.location: Located at the far end of the grail in the alcove. Look for the obvious dihedral with bolts.

content.description: Low bouldery crux to the 4th bolt and easy climbing thereafter.
content.protection: QDs to biners at the anchor
content.location: One route to the right of Greyhound and sharing the same anchors.

content.description: This line is wonderful, a continuous route with 13 bolts up varied slab and near-vertical climbing with interesting movement throughout.  Lots of variety in movement and holds.
content.location: Located on the "back walls" to the right of Watery Tart and Left of the 11d.  This route is maybe 20 yards to the left of the "stone saddle" or the alcove.  Third bolt line to the right of the start of the arch, second in from the right.

content.description: Accidently hopped on it, thinking it was City Dweller.  I overheard other locals suggest that this was 11D.  Felt about right.  Gaston movements on small edges and side pulls. Feet placement is delicate for the proper body positioning. Mostly vertical to pulling a slight bulgy, steeper section. Sustained and on you from the start, but broken up with mediocre rests.
content.location: Just right of City Dweller.  When you walk up to the right leaning arch, there are a few routes on the "back wall (aside from the ones in the Grail Alcove)." This is the fourth bolt line to the right from the arch.

content.description: Mainly slabby and vertical moderates on good, grey, water sculpted rock.
